titles.title: Expressing the sense of the Congress regarding the current level of violence between the Israelis and the Palestinians.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on International Relations.

bill.summary: 10/5/2000--Introduced. Condemns statements and actions by Palestinians designed to inflame and encourage violence. Demands that Palestinian Authority Chairman Yasser Arafat make a public appeal on Palestinian television for the public to cease further acts of violence.Urges the President to use all diplomatic means available to seek an end to the violence and return the Palestinians to the negotiating table.Supports Israeli Government actions designed to bring this current round of violence to a peaceful conclusion.Urges the Administration to oppose: (1) any United Nations effort to put forward one-sided anti-Israel resolutions or statements; and (2) the establishment of any international commissions of inquiry.States that the Congress will consider the response of Palestinians to the escalation of violence in their future relations with the United States.
